p: On the other hand, the voltage-gated K + channels are believed to be an important factor in the repolarization phase of peripheral nerves, especially the delayed rectifier potassium channel (K v). Some studies have demonstrated that the time constant of depolarization ( τ rep ) of the CAP can be used as a valuable tool for the investigation of potential K v blockers (Alves et al. 2010). Hence, it is unlikely that T. capitatus EO is related to this channel variety since no change in τ rep was observed ( Figure 3(B)).
